column4: My X refuses to start. I get a "no screens found" fatal error, even after doing a "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg".
Can you pastebin your xorg.conf?
i could try, but i'm stuck in a console-only.
Erp... Oh, yeah... what driver you using?
fglrx.
Sure driver is installed ?
on my integrated (this happened when I switched video cards) I went to restricted drivers and hit "Install FGLRX".
So can you verify it's installed?
by doing...?
aptitude search xorg-driver-fglrx   there should be an "I" next to it...
yeah, it's installed.
Maybe remove - do update and reinstall ;)
I also have a integrated, besides my dedicated, and I just thought that in dpkg-reconfigure, the default "Bus Identifier" might not be correct (pointing to the other card).
Oh, sorry didn't catch that - what's the bus id now?
My guess is PCI:1:0:0 :)
You can lspci | grep -i blah   if you're looking for something specific...
according to my LSPCI listing, i'm gonna try a different one, then try yours in case of failure.
(WW) fglrx: No matching Device section for instance (BusID PCI:1:5:0) found.
That's from xorg not lspci (?)
What about lspci | grep -i vga
You still there?
